page.title: 04PERSONALITIES
page.content: Many famous and infamous personalities are connected with Yateley. In 1394 John Bray,the Vicar,turned housebreaker.In 1607 Lord Monteagle discovered the Gunpowder plot, while living in Yateley (Monteagle House still stands).In 1671 Col. Blood who lived at Yateley was arrested after trying to steal the Crown Jewels.Between 1611-1700 smuggling was at its peak.In 1739 George III fell into the river Blackwater.In the 18th century Parson Darby was hanged for highway robbery.In 1841 Mrs.Henrietta Orr Ewing wrote 'Jackanapes' and Edward Caswall,hymn writer,was born in Yateley. Charlie Peace lived here c.19th century.In 1920 "I'll Walk Beside You" was written in Yateley by Alan Murray.
